title: Cloud DevOps Manager, IT
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.We're looking for a Cloud DevOps Manager, IT that is a creative, ambitious, self-directed technologist that wants to lead, and build, a team of highly skilled professionals, setting the direction for the team to grow, and develop operational processes to meet/exceed stringent SLA’s, and properly delegate work across the team required to execute.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
PLATFORM MANAGEMENT

Managing AWS, Azure and GCP Cloud infrastructure-related operations.
Ensure adherence to Service Levels Agreements for both response and resolution times.
Manage IT operations of SAAS Applications for Snowflake. 
Drive resilient platform operations and work with Apps/Data teams for 99.99% uptime.

CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT

Leads the development of enterprise DevOps, Security, and Monitoring & Alerts strategy and roadmaps, while driving a robust communication strategy to update internal stakeholders on service health, SLA tracking, incidents, and upcoming events.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including Development, QA, and Project Managers, Security, Compliance and, fostering a culture of DevSecOps across the organization.
Manage, mentor, and develop a high-performing DevOps team.
Monitor and analyze key performance metrics and trends to drive continuous improvement.
Advocate for automation and oversee the development and deployment of CI/CD pipelines.
Share an on-call rotation (follow the sun model) and be an escalation contact for service incidents for the team

WHAT WE NEED TO SEE:

B.Tech/B.E, B.S or MS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
12+ years of work experience in the IT Industry.
7+ with good exposure of DevOps & Site Reliability experience and managing DevOps/Cloud function
 3+ years of experience in  leading teams to build/manage software systems.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills while working with diverse audiences including highly technical IT professionals, developers, architects, and security architects.
Ability to write code in Python/Go/Perl/Powershell or similar to solve automation/glue problems and develop effective tooling.
Experience designing and implementing CI/CD pipeline security toolset (e.g Static/Dynamic Analysis and Security Testing (SAST/DAST), Software Composition Analysis (SCA), Image/Container/Container Registry scanning)
Knowledge & experience of Snowflake is a big plus.

TECH PROFILE/ESSENTIAL SKILLS

In-Depth knowledge on AWS services including VPC, IAM, EC2, RDS, EKS, CloudWatch, S3, RDS, Route53, Sagemaker. Experience in similar services for Azure is preferred.
Container orchestration - Docker, Kubernetes, 
Cloud Computing Service: AWS, Azure and GCP (AWS must)  
DevOps – Terraform, Ansible, CI/CD Pipeline / API, Jenkins, Argo CD, Jfrog
GitHub, GITLAB, Migration of Repository, Maintenance of Pipeline.  
Administration of Github, JIRA, Confluence, Google Suites
Experience with Active Directory, OKTA for SAML / SCIM provisioning.

questions.label: Where have you most recently worked?
Have you worked at Snowflake in the past in a Full-time, Part-time, contractor or Intern capacity?
For Snowflake to anticipate possible immigration timelines and obligations, could you confirm you are currently authorized to work in the country to which you are applying?

Will you require sponsorship to continue or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future (Example – including but not limited to: work permits such as H-1B in the United States, Highly Skilled Migrant in the Netherlands or a Blue Card in Poland or Germany. This could also include change of sponsorship from your current employer to Snowflake)?
A “U.S. person” is a citizen, legal permanent resident, or legal temporary resident (i.e., a refugee or asylee) of the United States. Which of the following best describes your “U.S. person” status?

values.label: I am a citizen of Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria AND I am NOT a U.S. person.
None of the above; I am a citizen of a different country.

questions.label: [US Applicants Only] Are you subject to any post-employment restrictions based on your role as a government (federal, state, local, or otherwise) employee or contractor, including representational restrictions or restrictions arising from work on a government procurement?
Due to SEC auditor independence requirements, please let us know whether you have previously worked at, or if currently working at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), who is our independent auditor.

values.label: Yes - I have previously worked at, or is currently working at PwC.
No - I have never been employed by PwC.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
